channel.title: Israeli dies in F16 crash
channel.description:
The death of Assaf Ramon, 20, whose father Ilan is a national hero, was described as piercing "the national heart" by Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister. "Today the entire nation is wrapped in unending grief for the death of Assaf, who fell from the heavens like his father, Ilan," he said. Assaf Ramon graduated from air force flying school only three months ago. His single-seat F16 went down near the Palestinian city of Hebron in the occupied West Bank. He was on a routine training flight. The space shuttle Columbia broke apart about 12 miles over Texas on Feb 1, 2003. Seven astronauts - six Americans and Ilan Ramon, an F16 pilot who took part in Israel's 1981 bombing of Iraq's nuclear reactor - died because of damage to the spacecraft's heat shield, caused during its launch two weeks earlier.
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/6184930/Israeli-hero-astronauts-son-dies-in-F16-crash-in-West-Bank.html 1 Less terrorist in this world. Discuss.

item.title: Israeli dies in F16 crash
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:36, topic:302911”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=399177.msg2961909#msg2961909 date=1253290065]

1 Less terrorist in this world. Discuss.

He was Israeli, which the Arab terrorists hate, so he wasn’t a terrorist.

So everyone who the ‘arab terrorists’ hate is good? Does that justify all the bombs that these Israeli pilots drop on innocent civilians? Don’t forget the 2000 civilians that were killed in Gaza, and the thousands of others that were killed in the region ever since 1948.

Why call the Arabs terrorists? They’re trying to defend their land and people, which Israel thinks are expendable. Look at this map and tell me who the territory truly belongs to:

[img]http://img514.imageshack.us/img514/6726/israelstealingpalestine.jpg[ /img]

Don’t forget that the Israelie ‘civilians’ are occupying land illegally.

Edit: Were you being sarcastic? :P. Excuse me if I missed it.
[/quote]

Just to clarify I was most certainly not calling all Arabs terrorists, I was referring specifically to the ones that are terrorists.

I don’t think an Israeli soldier is a terrorist, of course history has shown that the other side in a fight will always try to make the enemy look as bad as possible. In the USA for example, when the english were taking lands from the indians by force, when the english beat the indians in a battle, even if their casualties were a bit higher, it was called a great victory. But when the indians won, no matter how fair the fight, it was called a massacre. Same thing here, right?[/quote]

Exactly the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Israeli dies in F16 crash
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

yakman:

you proudly point out the Isreali atrocities but you choose to ignore the Palestinian ones.

The atrocities commited by Israel are far greater in magnitude, look at the past two wars in the region. Israel killed at least 10 civilians for every civilian they lost.

Now consider the fact that Israel is equiped with the world’s latest in weapons technology. It is well within their capability to hit their target with extreme precision. The Palestinian factions and hezbollah are very poorly armed. They don’t have the capability to hit the targets they desire, although hamas has claimed that it has aimed its rockets at Israeli military bases. Taking this into consideration, shouldn’t the soldier:civilian death ratio be the opposite of what it is?

Take a look at the casualties in the latest war:

Israel - Total killed: 13 (10 soldiers & 3 civilians)
Gaza - Total killed: 1,417 (491 Militants & policemen, 926 civilians with over 4,000 homes destroyed & around $2bn worth of damage to Gaza)
